org.actus.externals

Interface RiskFactorModelProvider


  • public interface RiskFactorModelProvider
    A representation of an external Comprehensive Risk Factor Model

    Generally, the payoff of financial instruments is evaluated in the context of an environment that embodies the dynamics (and therewith future states) of all relevant stochastic risk factors - or what we call the Comprehensive Risk Factor Model. Thus, method lifecycle of a ContractType produces a series of Risk Factor state contingent ContractEvents. An external RiskFactorModelProvider implements these dynamics and allows to retrieve the state of all defined risk factors identified through a unique id at any future time.

    Note, all sorts of external variables on which the payoff of a ContractType is conditioned must be implemented in the RiskFactorModelProvider. In particular, any source of market risk, credit risk, or behavioral risk needs to be represented therein and identifiable through a unique ID. Examples of such risk factors are the reference market rate linked to through contract attribute MarketObjectCodeOfRateReset, the default indicator of a legal entity linked to e.g. through attribute LegalEntityIDCounterparty, or the market value of an underlying linked to through attribute ContractID of the underlying.

    See Also:
    ACTUS

      • stateAt

        double stateAt(String id,
               LocalDateTime time,
               StateSpace contractStates,
               ContractModelProvider contractAttributes)
        Returns the state of a particular risk factor at a future time
        Parameters:
        id - identifier of the risk factor
        time - future time for which to return the risk factor's state
        contractStates - the inner states of the contract as per @code{time} argument of the method
        contractAttributes - the attributes of the contract calling the method
        Returns:
        double the state of the risk factor
